name: John Smith
bio: John Smith is a classically trained chef with a passion for modern fusion cuisine. He has worked in some of the top restaurants around the world and has won numerous awards for his innovative dishes.

recipes.name: Lobster Thermidor
recipes.method: 1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. 2. Cut the cooked lobster meat into chunks. 3. Melt the butter in a pan and sauté the shallots until soft. 4. Add the white wine and cook until reduced by half. 5. Add the cream and mustard and simmer until the sauce thickens. 6. Stir in the lobster meat and cheese. 7. Pour the mixture into a baking dish and sprinkle with breadcrumbs. 8. Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.

recipes.name: Beef Wellington
recipes.method: 1. Preheat the oven to 425°F. 2. Season the beef tenderloin with salt and pepper. 3. Sear the beef in a hot pan until browned on all sides. 4. Remove the beef from the pan and set aside to cool. 5. In the same pan, sauté the mushrooms and shallots until soft. 6. Roll out the puff pastry and place the beef on top. 7. Spoon the mushroom mixture over the beef. 8. Fold the puff pastry over the beef and seal the edges. 9. Brush the pastry with egg wash. 10. Bake in the oven for 25-30 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown.

recipes.name: Crème Brûlée
recipes.method: 1. Preheat the oven to 325°F. 2. In a saucepan, heat the cream and vanilla extract until hot. 3. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the sugar and egg yolks. 4. Slowly pour the hot cream into the egg mixture, whisking continuously. 5. Pour the mixture into ramekins. 6. Place the ramekins in a baking dish and fill the dish with hot water. 7. Bake in the oven for 30-35 minutes or until set. 8. Chill the crème brûlée in the fridge for at least 2 hours. 9. Sprinkle sugar over the top of each ramekin and use a blowtorch to caramelize the sugar.
